subs.text: September 2022
subs.name: september2022

subs.text: September 6

@bluegriff @domesticat It still feels fraught with peril. I have to test the timestamp sharing link each time before sharing, because who knows what changes with inline previews since the last time I shared it? And then there’s the end of the video where it references the beginning.
subs.rawText: @bluegriff @domesticat It still feels fraught with peril. I have to test the timestamp sharing link each time before sharing, because who knows what changes with inline previews since the last time I shared it? And then there’s the end of the video where it references the beginning.

subs.text: @domesticat I think about the parody of how both songs came to be a lot. (The first scene makes me reluctant to share it more widely.) [link]

subs.text: September 5

My handsome heroism last night at the Wu-Tang Clan concert was to zip up the backpack of a quite intoxicated woman. (I wonder how long she went with it open. It takes Torontonians a really long time to point something like that out.) I got a friendly pat on the shoulder for that.
subs.rawText: My handsome heroism last night at the Wu-Tang Clan concert was to zip up the backpack of a quite intoxicated woman. (I wonder how long she went with it open. It takes Torontonians a really long time to point something like that out.) I got a friendly pat on the shoulder for that.

subs.text: @Kimli I made a note about it for when it comes up in Timehop, because of how often I don’t remember what the hell I was talking about a year (or years) later, but otherwise, thank you so much for the compliment!
subs.rawText: @Kimli I made a note about it for when it comes up in Timehop, because of how often I don’t remember what the hell I was talking about a year (or years) later, but otherwise, thank you so much for the compliment!

subs.text: @DanFitzWrites I unfollowed mine, because they weren’t talking to me when I did interact with them, and it got to be too hard to be reminded of my fancies on a daily basis. I think it’s fine to have crushes, but I would never tell them (it was a mistake to reveal who one was to a third party). [link]

subs.text: It’s hard to imagine a Labour Day Parade trailer squeezing in more things that I love on it, but the Laborers' International Union of North America Labour Day Parade squeezed in a lot of them. [link]

subs.text: It wasn’t me wearing a hard hat and raising my left fist at the CN Tower, but it could’ve been me.
subs.rawText: It wasn’t me wearing a hard hat and raising my left fist at the CN Tower, but it could’ve been me.

subs.text: I walked along with the United Steelworkers float, in part because the DJ was playing reggae music, but also because it was the union my dad’s forest workers union merged with. [link]
subs.rawText: I walked along with the United Steelworkers float, in part because the DJ was playing reggae music, but also because it was the union my dad’s forest workers union merged with. https://t.co/7RsCPfBlTK

subs.text: I always speed-run parades, and I don’t always stay till the end of them. For this year’s edition of the Toronto Labour Day Parade, I’ll never know if there was a rendition of “Union Strike Folk Song (Parts 1 & 2)” in the remaining floats. [link]
subs.rawText: I always speed-run parades, and I don’t always stay till the end of them. For this year’s edition of the Toronto Labour Day Parade, I’ll never know if there was a rendition of “Union Strike Folk Song (Parts 1 & 2)” in the remaining floats. https://t.co/Bm82yaHE8w

subs.text: In a previous life, in a case of mistaken identity, a woman did contact me because of what she saw on a website of mine, and we did go on to have a long-term relationship. The conditions are not right for that lightning bolt to strike again.
